courses.title: Master Generative AI: GPT, LLMs, Agents & Use Cases
courses.bio: Understand how Generative AI, GPT, LLMs, and AI Agents work—and how they’re transforming business, work, and creativity.

Foundations of AI and Generative Models: What is 'GPT' and how do they work
What are LLMs and how do they work?
AI Landscape & Evolution: New Age AI vs Old School AI
What is Happening in AI in 2025?

requirements: No prior AI or coding experience required — just basic digital literacy and a curious mindset.
courses.description:
Generative AI is no longer some futuristic concept — it's the reality shaping the present. From writing tools and code generation to business automation and personal assistants, it's everywhere. And the world needs people who not only use it, but truly understand how it works.

Powered by Supervity AI, this course is intended for learners of all categories.

Whether you're a student looking to stay ahead, a professional aiming to future-proof your career, or just someone fascinated by the power of AI, this course is your gateway into the world of Generative AI — explained in clear, human terms.
This beginner-friendly course will give you a solid foundation in the core ideas behind modern AI systems. You’ll explore how Large Language Models (LLMs) like GPT are trained, how they generate natural-sounding content, and how they're transforming industries — from marketing and customer service to law, healthcare, and education.
But we won't stop at the basics. You'll also discover the next evolution: AI Agents and RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) — systems that don’t just generate text, but take action, retrieve information, and assist users in real-world workflows. You’ll learn how they work, where they're being applied, and what makes them different from traditional automation or rule-based bots.
We’ll unpack key technical terms like tokens, context windows, and hallucinations — and explain what they actually mean for you as a user or creator. We'll also explore the real-world risks and responsibilities of using these powerful tools, including bias, misinformation, privacy concerns, and the growing importance of AI governance.
What You’ll Learn:
What Generative AI is — and how it’s different from traditional rule-based AI
How powerful models like GPT and other LLMs are trained and how they generate content
The difference between a chatbot and an AI Agent — and how agentic workflows are driving the next wave of automation
What RAG is, and why it's a game-changer for knowledge retrieval and intelligent assistants
Key concepts like tokens, context windows, hallucinations, and how to think about AI-generated content critically
An introduction to AI Ethics, Risks, and Governance — what you need to know before applying AI in business or society
Learn about how Supervity AI is enabling learners.
Who Is This Course For?
Students preparing for an AI-driven job market
Working professionals across domains like marketing, HR, operations, design, or education
Founders, creators, and solopreneurs looking to explore how AI can boost their work
Curious learners who want to go beyond the hype and actually understand how generative AI works
No prior technical knowledge or coding background is required — just curiosity, a willingness to learn, and the imagination to see what's possible.
By the end of this course, you won’t just know what Generative AI is — you’ll be able to talk about it confidently, apply it meaningfully, and start thinking about how you can build, create, or lead with AI in your world.


This course is powered by Supervity AI.
target_audience: This course is for professionals, students, and curious learners who want to understand and apply Generative AI without any technical background.

courses.description:
How AI & Machine Learning Change Your Business Analyst Career
Anyone defining requirements for digital solutions must keep up with new trends in technology such as Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Big Data to remain relevant in the workforce.
The requirements elicitation and analysis process is just as crucial for AI initiatives as it is for any other project. Business stakeholders and technical experts like data scientists, chatbot developers, or machine learning engineers involved in an AI project need to collaborate to produce a successful product.
This course is a management overview of what emerging disciplines like Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Analysis, Business Analytics, and Chatbots (Conversational User Interfaces) offer organizations and how the role commonly called Business Analyst must morph to stay relevant.
-----


Business Analysts Make Sure Technological Developments Drive Business Value
The role of the business analyst is to help organizations with their decision-making process by asking questions and analyzing data to better understand what they need. With the emergence of AI, data scientists need input from business analysts about what type of information is needed to generate AI models.
The course presents an example of the evolving role of business analysts in the development of a directed chatbot.
-----


Revolutionize Your Customer Service or Product Sales
Learn how to create a chatbot or conversational user interface for your company or yourself with our in-depth course "How to Design, Build, Deploy, and Manage Directed Chatbots" (available on Udemy).
-----


About the Instructor
Teaches 12 Udemy courses for Agile Business Analysis with over 60,000 students enrolled.
Champions lean and agile methods to meet communication challenges between business and IT communities.
Maintains an extensive YouTube Channel with over 100 videos for 17K+ subscribers and 1.6M+ views.
Authored 12 Business Analysis books covering tools and techniques for Agile and traditional software requirements.
Consultant to a multitude of Fortune 500 companies and governmental agencies.
Facilitated 100’s of User Story and Requirements Gathering Workshops for multi-million-dollar projects.
25+ years’ experience with instructor-led training for tens of thousands of students around the world.
Coach and mentor for aspiring business analysts.
Enroll now to learn how to prepare for the changes these revolutionary technologies represent.

requirements: No previous experience needed. In this series of 8 video lessons, you can engage in a flexible and self-paced learning experience, the lessons feature specialists who share their stories and expertise, providing valuable insights.
courses.description:
Investments in building resilience must be evidence-based and targeted at people in need to ensure no one is left behind.
The 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development underlines the importance of high-quality data generated at the national level to track progress toward development goals. This requires strong localized evaluation systems and the COVID-19 pandemic has only highlighted this.
This Masterclass shares progress and lessons learned to strengthen national evaluation systems, and how these systems are essential for countries to ‘build forward better’ and get back on track toward reaching the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
Discover the importance of evaluation for achieving SDGs and making evidence-based decisions. Strengthen national evaluation systems for better progress tracking. Utilize evaluation to inform budgets, policies, and strategies for improved development outcomes. Overcome challenges in evaluation for effective decision-making and policy formulation.
Watch the 8 video lessons to hear from experts who contributed to the 2022 National Evaluation Capacities Conference in Turin. Learn from UN officials, government officials, civil society organizations, evaluation associations, and the global evaluation community at large.

objectives: To demystify AI writing tools and present them as collaborative partners
To provide hands-on experience with practical AI writing tools
To equip participants with techniques for brainstorming, outlining, and drafting content using AI
To offer strategies for editing and refining AI-generated content
To explore how AI can be used for diverse writing styles and formats

AI: Your Creative Collaborator: Consider your strategy and how you will use AI
Outlining with AI: Structuring Your Cont: Using AI to create outlines, section headings, subheadings and clarity and flow
Resource List: AI Tools and Tutorials

requirements: No previous experience is necessary.
courses.description:
Ever stare at a blank page and just... freeze? We've all been there. This course is all about breaking through those creative blocks with AI. We'll dive into tools that can help you brainstorm ideas, generate outlines, and even draft content. Think of it as learning how to collaborate with AI, not replace yourself. It's about getting those creative juices flowing and making writing fun again.
Key Takeaways
Hands-on experience with AI writing tools.
Techniques for using AI to generate ideas and outlines.
Tips for editing and refining AI-generated content.
How to use AI for different writing styles and formats.
Deliverables
Access to presentation materials.
Interactive prompts, examples and projects.
Resource list with AI tools and tutorials.
What We'll Cover
Hands-on experience with AI writing tools.
Techniques for generating ideas and outlines.
Editing and refining AI-generated content.
Using AI for diverse writing styles and formats.
Resource list with AI art tools and tutorials.
Interactive prompts, examples and projects.
Your first question on AI’s role in your content operations should be, “Where does it make the most sense to use it?”
Focus on impact
Make sure AI’s incorporation aligns with your company. Start with your mission and values and see if using artificial intelligence contradicts them.
Consider how the AI tools’ capabilities work with your marketing and business priorities.
Think about the questions you’ve been unable to answer or problems you’ve struggled to solve.
Consider where these AI tools can help increase brand value or marketing impact. Will it help increase audience reach or enable you to branch out to new creative areas?
Explore efficiency gains
Use AI to tackle smaller, time-consuming assignments like writing search-optimized headlines, compiling outlines and executive summaries, and repurposing articles for social posts and promotions.
This approach frees your team to explore new creative avenues and focus on work they’re more passionate about.
Fill skill gaps and resource shortfalls
AI can also fill in where your team lacks technical skills.
Communicate requirements clearly
Introducing AI tools usually requires some adjustments to the way your team works, such as adding steps to a collaborative workflow or rebalancing team members’ roles and responsibilities.
But it could also require you to provide training and guidance. For example, a team member who writes clear, concise content briefs might help train others on the team about crafting effective AI prompts.
Check your facts
Generative AI can produce content with misleading or inaccurate information. This can happen if it doesn’t have access to enough relevant data in its training model to respond accurately to your prompt or if the data it used included inaccuracies. So, publishing AI-generated content without careful editorial oversight isn’t wise.
Be mindful of mediocrity
Even if your AI-created copy is editorially impeccable, it can still come off as generic, bland, and uninspiring. Involving your human team at every step of the creative process can mitigate these challenges.
target_audience: Designers, Creatives, Content Creators, Marketers, and anyone facing creative blocks in writing.

courses.description:
【どうせやるならNo１ツールを】
BIツール、かつては、分析業務にがっつり浸った一部の人のための【閉じた】ツールでした。今では、大小含めて様々なツールが登場し、【セルフサービスBI】ということで、みなさん自身がご自分でデータを抽出、加工し、その結果をビジュアル化するような時代になっています。
データ至上主義とも言われる現在のビジネス界において、一部では”Power BI is new Power Point. （Power BIこそ、次のPower Point）”、つまりこれからのプレゼンソフトのスタンダートは、Power BIになる、とまで言われています。
その中でもMicrosoft社が提供するPower BI Desktopは、IT業界で権威のあるガートナーマジッククアドラントで常にリーダーであり、ビジョナリーであり続けます。
このコースでは、そのMicrosoft Power BI Desktopを、全く使ったことがない、というレベルから、ダッシュボードが作成できるレベルまでをサポートします。


【どうせやるなら実戦的で楽しいコースを】
単なるぶつ切りの機能の紹介だけではつまらない。それならYouTubeでもできます。このコースはUdemyコースならではの一貫性のあるコースとしてデザインしています。みなさんには、スマートウォッチメーカーである架空の会社、Gannett（ガネット）社のマーケティング担当になっていただきます。そして、みなさんの手元には競合他社も含めた３年分、エクセルの行にして3,000,000行以上のバラバラの生データがあります。
このコースでは、こららの生データを抽出、加工し、そしてビジュアル化します。しかも、単にビジュアル化して終わり、ではなくビジュアル化した後のデータを更に分析する、というみなさんの日々のお仕事ですぐに応用できるように構成しています。コースの途中では、私の実務でのPower BI Desktopの経験談などを踏まえ、楽しく進められるように工夫しました。


【Nothing to Lose, But All to Gain】
このコースは、30日間無条件での返金保証がついています。そして、Power BI Desktop は Microsoft のサイトより無料でダウンロードできます。ですので、みなさんには、失うものはなく、一方でこれから必須のスキルと言われるBIツール、しかもNo１のPower BI Desktopを使いこなせるチャンスだけがあります。BIツールへの第一歩、このコースをきっかけにしませんか？
それではコースでお会いしましょう！

requirements: Microsoft Excel (Office 2021 or Microsoft 365) installed.
Basic knowledge of Excel (e.g., entering data, simple calculations).
Access to a computer with a stable internet connection.
No prior advanced Excel skills required; suitable for beginners.
courses.description:
This course provides a practical, hands-on approach to building financial models in Microsoft Excel, focusing on loans, investments, and discounting techniques. Designed for students, professionals, and business users, the course covers essential financial concepts and shows how to apply them using Excel’s built-in formulas and functions.
In the loan-focused section, students will explore the time value of money and learn to calculate loan payments, interest, and principal using functions like PMT, IPMT, and PPMT. They’ll build amortization schedules—both fixed-rate and dynamic—and analyze balloon loans, principal paydowns, and variable-rate mortgages. Additional lessons guide learners through determining loan terms, calculating borrowing capacity, and solving for interest rates.
The investment section shifts toward building future value models. Students will calculate the value of lump sums, recurring deposits, and mixed investments, using compound interest and both nominal and effective rates. They’ll also develop investment schedules and solve for required contributions to meet financial goals.
Finally, the course introduces discounting techniques to evaluate the present value of future cash flows. Learners will work with NPV, IRR, and payback period functions to assess investment performance. Real-world scenarios such as leasing vs. buying and property investment decisions are included.
By the end of this course, students will be able to build accurate financial models in Excel to support smarter personal, academic, and business decisions
target_audience: Learn to calculate loan payments, terms, interest, and principal using Excel.
Build both fixed and dynamic loan amortization schedules.
Understand balloon loans and model principal paydowns over time.
Use Excel to determine how much you can borrow or repay.

courses.title: CBAP - Certified Business Analysis Professional - 2026 Exams
courses.bio: CBAP, Certified Business Analysis Professional. updated 2026, CCBA, Business Analysis, Business Analytics, Strategy
courses.description:
1. CBAP certificate ( Certified Business Analysis Professional )
CBAP certificate is an international certificate issued by the International Institute of Business Analysis ( IIBA ). This certification is recognized worldwide and is a gold standard for business analytics professionals. To achieve CBAP certification, test takers need to meet the following requirements:
Have at least 7,500 hours of work experience in business analytics.
Complete 37 PD (Professional Development Units) in areas related to business analytics.
Pass the CBAP exam.
If you are looking for a valuable international certification in the field of business analytics, the CBAP certification is a great choice. This certificate will help you improve your knowledge and skills, increase your competitiveness in the labor market and open up many career advancement opportunities.


CBAP Exam Blueprint
1. Business analysis planning and monitoring     14%
This area of the CBAP exam syllabus concentrates on the responsibilities linked to organizing and overseeing the business analysis tasks throughout a project. It involves recognizing stakeholders, outlining business analysis activities, setting up business analysis governance, strategizing business analysis information management, and pinpointing enhancements in business analysis performance. The main subjects encompass:
Planning the approach to business analysis
Stakeholder analysis and engagement
Governance over business analysis activities
Information management and requirements traceability
Performance improvement for business analysis processes.


2. Elicitation and collaboration                                12%
Engaging in elicitation and collaboration entails collaborating with individuals involved to collect needs and confirming that these needs are comprehended, recorded, and endorsed. This area encompasses:
Preparing for and conducting elicitation activities
Documenting and confirming elicitation results
Collaboration and communication with stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle
Techniques for Effective Stakeholder Engagement.


3. Requirements life cycle management               15%
This section deals with managing requirement statuses from the beginning to the execution stage throughout the project's lifespan. Activities consist of tracking, sustaining, ranking, and evaluating modifications to the requirements. The subjects encompass:
Traceability and monitoring of requirements
Requirements prioritization and management of changes
Ensuring requirements are adequately maintained throughout the project
Assessment of changes and their impact on the project.


4. Strategy analysis                                                    15%
In the Strategy Analysis portion of the CBAP exam syllabus, the main goal is to pinpoint the business requirements that steer a project, evaluate any skill gaps, and decide on the approach for a solution. This area covers:
Analysis of the current state and definition of the future state
Assessment of risks and definition of the change strategy
Identification and evaluation of potential solutions to fulfill business needs.
5. Requirements analysis and design definition  30%
In this field, the focus is on translating business and stakeholder needs into details that can be put into action through IT systems or business process enhancements. Important areas to consider are;
Specification and modeling of requirements
Verification and validation of requirements
Definition of requirements architecture
Determination of solution options that meet business needs.
6. Solution evaluation                                                14%
When evaluating solutions, it's important to assess whether they meet the criteria and provide the anticipated benefits to the company. This area includes:
Assessment of solution performance against desired outcomes
Identification and management of solution limitations
Evaluation of potential enhancements to increase solution value.




2. CCBA certificate ( Certification of Capability in Business Analysis )
CCBA certificate is an international certificate issued by the International Institute of Business Analysis ( IIBA ). This certification is recognized worldwide and is an intermediate-level certification for business analytics professionals. To achieve CCBA certification, candidates need to meet the following requirements:
Have at least 2,500 hours of work experience in business analytics.
Complete 21 PD (Professional Development Units) in areas related to business analytics.
Pass the CCBA exam.
The CCBA exam is a multiple-choice exam with 120 questions and a test duration of 2 hours and 30 minutes. The test is designed to assess test takers' knowledge and skills in various aspects of business analytics.


CCBA Exam Blueprint
Business Analysis Planning and Monitoring         12%
Elicitation and Collaboration                                    20%
Requirements Life Cycle Management                  18%
Strategy Analysis                                                         12%
Requirements Analysis and Design Definition      32%
Solution Evaluation                                                      6%
target_audience: Business Analyst, Financial Analyst, BI Analyst

courses.description:
AI has become a game-changer in HR by automating repetitive tasks, enhancing decision-making, and improving employee engagement. This course explores the profound impact of artificial intelligence (AI) on modern HR practices. It delves into how AI is transforming recruitment, employee engagement, performance management, and workforce development by automating processes, enhancing decision-making, and improving efficiency.
Students will learn how AI-driven tools streamline hiring through automated resume screening, candidate sourcing, and predictive analytics, helping organizations make more data-driven talent decisions. The paper also discusses AI’s role in employee wellness, using sentiment analysis and behavioral data to detect burnout risks, enhance retention strategies, and create personalized career development paths. AI-powered performance management tools ensure real-time feedback, unbiased evaluations, and continuous learning opportunities, enabling employees to grow while aligning with business goals.
Additionally, the course highlights the importance of predictive analytics in workforce planning, allowing HR teams to anticipate turnover risks and optimize succession planning. Ethical considerations such as AI bias, data privacy, and transparency are also addressed, ensuring responsible AI implementation. By the end of the playbook, students will have a deep understanding of AI’s potential to reshape HR, making it more strategic, personalized, and efficient, ultimately driving business success and employee satisfaction.

requirements: Interest in Statistics, Data Analysis, Data Science

courses.description:
Are you thinking to pursue career in data analytics, then this is the right course for you. This course begins with basic lectures on statistical measures and tests, introduces SPSS software to you. Gradually you will be taught how to draw graphs, and charts using SPSS, and analyze data using descriptive statistics. You will also learn how to edit SPSS graphs, charts, and tables in MS Word and MS excel.
Once you are familiar with these basic things, then the course will introduce analyses of single samples drawn from different measurement scales. Next, you will learn how to analyze two data from two independent samples and two related samples.
Next, you will be introduced to analyses of K independent samples, and K multiple samples. At the end you will learn how to find out association or agreement between two and multiple variables.
In all, this course has 9 sections and 35 video lectures. First, 14 lectures are basics, and remaining 21 lectures are on analyzing data gathered using questionnaire or survey instrument with the help of nonparametric statistical tests.
Each of these nonparametric statistical tests are explained with real world data. The data sheets of each lecture is also included in the lecture. After watching the lecture you can practice and gain hands on experience.
We are confident that if you learn this course perfectly you will have great career in data analytics arena.

courses.title: Solving Complex Business Problem - Data Analytics Solutions
courses.bio: Introducing Data Analytics solutions cover build data pipeline, design metrics system, and automate with Power BI
requirements: No programming languages needed, understanding SQL can be helpful for advanced DAX function usage
courses.description:
Complex business problems can often feel overwhelming, yet they can be solved effectively with the right data analytics solutions. In fact, when adopted properly, analytics is highly cost-effective in the long run. Whether you are a small SME, a solopreneur, a startup, or a multinational corporation, moving toward a more mature data analytics approach is essential for sustainable growth and competitiveness.
From a business perspective, for smaller companies, the most important step is simply to start. Building strong analytics capabilities takes time and effort, and it is not a task for one individual alone. Instead, it requires commitment across the entire organization, beginning with senior management. Some industries face even greater urgency, particularly those handling large volumes of data. Examples include car rental companies, education centres, travel agencies, health clinics, and real estate or insurance agencies. Many of these businesses still rely on manual, paper-based processes such as printed checklists or invoices. These methods are error-prone and time-consuming, problems that analytics can quickly resolve by streamlining workflows and providing clearer insights.
From a technical perspective, key steps include building a data warehouse, designing data pipelines, and selecting suitable methods for metrics design and analysis flows. Advanced visualizations also play a critical role, making complex information easy to interpret and act upon. Together, these solutions strengthen data flows, reduce reliance on fragmented systems, and establish a reliable single source of truth for decision-making.
Ultimately, while business leaders already understand their domain expertise, data solutions enable them to transform raw data into structured insights. This creates a logical flow that supports actionable decisions, enhances KPIs, and ensures long-term monitoring for continuous improvement.
target_audience: This course is designed for function leaders and data professionals who want to harness advanced tools to drive impactful business outcomes and stay ahead of industry trends
Business leaders who would like to employ advanced data solution

courses.title: Beyond Excel: Modernizing Data Management for Businesses
courses.bio: Recognizing the Limitations of Spreadsheets
requirements: Experience of working with spreadsheets in an office environment
courses.description:
Are you tired of wrestling with spreadsheets that seem to have a mind of their own? Many organizations, from small businesses to large enterprises, find themselves trapped in a cycle of spreadsheet-related frustrations. They grapple with the practical nightmares of reconciling conflicting data versions, spending countless hours generating reports that are often already out of date, and constantly worrying about the security of sensitive information stored within these vulnerable files. These challenges not only waste valuable time and resources but also hinder informed decision-making and impede growth.
This course is designed to help you break free from the "Spreadsheet Trap." We'll delve into the root causes of these persistent issues by thoroughly examining the inherent limitations of spreadsheets when used for managing business-critical data. We’ll explore how the very flexibility that makes spreadsheets initially appealing ultimately becomes their downfall.
We’ll analyze how spreadsheets’ free-form, unstructured nature leads to a cascade of problems, including:
Data inconsistencies and errors: We’ll uncover how the lack of enforced data types and validation rules leads to inaccuracies and makes data analysis unreliable.
Limited scalability: We'll demonstrate how spreadsheets struggle to handle growing data volumes and increasing user demands, creating performance bottlenecks and hindering business expansion.
Weak security: We’ll expose the vulnerabilities of spreadsheets to unauthorized access, data breaches, and accidental deletion, putting sensitive information at significant risk.
Hidden costs of manual workarounds: We'll reveal the often-overlooked expenses associated with manual data entry, formula maintenance, and error correction, which drain resources and divert valuable time from strategic initiatives.
We’ll begin with a deep dive into the concept of the “Spreadsheet Trap.” This foundational understanding is crucial for appreciating why adopting modern data management principles and technologies is not just an option, but a necessity for thriving in today’s data-driven world. This introductory module will lay the groundwork for the powerful solutions and strategies we'll explore in subsequent modules, equipping you with the knowledge and skills to move beyond spreadsheets and unlock the true potential of your data.

講師は、日立、日産で20年にわたる豊富な実務経験を持ち、現在は多数の企業や自治体、国の組織で「データ分析活用」「問題解決」のスキル育成に携わる第一人者です。他にも、大学院でMBA客員教授（クリティカルシンキング）、大学でビジネス系の教鞭を多数取る「教えるプロ」による講義です。


具体的には以下のスキルを修得します：
・ （提案や問題解決など）ゴールに対するデータやデータ分析の活かし方
・プレゼンや提案、報告などの実務で、データにより客観性、説得力を持たせるスキル
・上記を実現するための単なるテクニックではなく、「考え方」や「プロセス」
・単独の分析結果獲得だけで終わらせず、ストーリー（結論）作りに活かす方法


尚、本コースではQ&Aの対応はありませんのでご注意下さい。


次のキーワードに興味がある方は是非検討下さい：
「データ分析」「データ活用」「提案」「プレゼンテーション」「問題解決」「Story-telling」「データサイエンス」
target_audience: 分析の“やり方” ではなく、実践的なデータの“活かし方”を学ぶことによって、自分のアウトプットの質（説得力）を激増させたい人
データ分析のテクニックや知識はすでに学んでおり、活用するための「考え方」を学ぶ機会を探している人
ストーリーに沿い、データに基づいた説得力あるプレゼン・提案スキルを得たい人

courses.title: CBAP Certification Practice Exams
courses.bio: Master the CBAP exam with extensive practice tests based on the BABOK Guide v3.
courses.description:

In this comprehensive program, we provide a rich repository of practice exams meticulously aligned with the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK) Guide v3. With over 120 challenging questions, our course ensures that you are not just prepared but excel in every aspect of the CBAP examination. The importance of CBAP certification in enhancing your business analysis skills cannot be overstated, as this credential is an industry benchmark recognized globally.
The course is structured to simulate the actual exam experience. This structure allows you to foster a deep understanding of the material while aligning closely with the actual format of the CBAP exam. You will benefit from detailed feedback on every question, helping you identify areas of strength and topics requiring further study.
A unique feature of this course is the accessibility of resources and the flexibility it offers. You can study at your own pace, making it easier to balance learning with personal and professional commitments. With 24/7 access to course materials, you can take quick quizzes or deep-dive into complex topics as it fits into your schedule. This self-paced format not only enhances learning but also encourages consistent practice, which is essential for mastering the content.
Understanding that various learners have different styles, this course incorporates a multitude of learning tools and techniques. There is an emphasis on real-world applications, drawing from insights provided by seasoned business analysis experts. These experienced instructors contribute valuable perspectives and proven techniques that prepare candidates for both the exam and practical applications in the field.
Furthermore, our program focuses on key domains outlined in the CBAP certification framework, ensuring that you grasp essential concepts, techniques, and best practices in business analysis. The questions are specifically designed to challenge you, reflecting the latest updates and trends in the business analysis field, guaranteeing that you're studying relevant content that will be tested on the actual exam.
Importantly, we empower you with proven strategies for effective test-taking. You will learn how to analyze questions strategically, manage your exam time efficiently, and approach the exam with reduced stress and increased confidence. The course also incorporates techniques for marking questions for review, letting you return to complex items before final submission, ensuring you can maximize your potential score.
As you embark on this learning journey, significant outcomes await you. By the conclusion of the course, you will have not only acquired a profound mastery over the CBAP Exam content but also developed the capability to implement best practices in diverse organizational settings. This skillset is critical for advancing your career and for making impactful contributions to your organization.
Enroll today to start your preparation for the CBAP certification exam with confidence. Our commitment to providing regularly updated materials ensures that you are always learning the most current content available, empowering you to succeed in your professional endeavors. This course is a gateway to achieving your CBAP certification and unlocking enhanced opportunities in the field of business analysis.

Experienced professionals looking to refresh their knowledge and stay updated in the business analysis field.

Our expert-led content is meticulously designed to mirror the actual CCAT exam format, question types, and difficulty level. By simulating real test conditions multiple times, you will build endurance, reduce test anxiety, and enhance your speed and accuracy. Whether you're a recent graduate, a professional looking for a career change, or aiming for a promotion, mastering the CCAT can set you apart from other candidates.
Enroll today and transform your CCAT preparation. Develop the skills needed not just to pass, but to achieve a top percentile score that opens doors to competitive job opportunities. Prepare smarter, not just harder, and confidently step into your next interview knowing you're fully equipped to demonstrate your cognitive abilities.

They’ll perform multi-column and drop-down-based lookups using XLOOKUP.

Working with Lookup Functions: Working with Lookup Functions
Taking a Look at Excel's Lookup Functions
Understanding Lookup Tables
The CHOOSE Function
Using CHOOSE Function to Determine Month of the Fiscal Year
Using CHOOSE Function to Determine Day of the Week
Integrating CHOOSE and Worksheet Option Buttons

requirements: Microsoft Excel (Office 2021 or Microsoft 365) installed.
Basic knowledge of Excel (e.g., entering data, simple calculations).
Access to a computer with a stable internet connection.
No prior advanced Excel skills required; suitable for beginners.
courses.description:
Working with Lookup Functions, provides learners with the essential tools and techniques to retrieve and reference data efficiently in Excel using various lookup functions. This chapter starts by explaining the structure and purpose of lookup tables, then introduces the CHOOSE function. Students will use CHOOSE to return specific values like fiscal months or days of the week and learn to integrate this function with worksheet controls such as option buttons to make their spreadsheets more interactive and responsive.
The chapter then dives into classic lookup methods with VLOOKUP and HLOOKUP, guiding learners through both approximate and exact-match lookups. Practical examples include returning discount or tax rates and using drop-down lists to dynamically drive lookup values. These real-world scenarios help students understand how to make their formulas both flexible and user-friendly.
As the course progresses, students will master INDEX and MATCH, a powerful combination that offers more control and adaptability than traditional lookup functions. They’ll learn to perform lookups across any row or column, handle dynamic data structures, and return values from multiple columns based on variable input.
The chapter concludes with an in-depth look at XLOOKUP, the modern replacement for older lookup functions. Students will learn to perform exact and multi-column lookups using any column as the search key, integrate XLOOKUP with drop-downs, and build responsive worksheets that adjust automatically as data changes.
By the end of Chapter 7, learners will have a strong grasp of both legacy and modern lookup functions in Excel. They’ll be able to create intelligent, dynamic spreadsheets that locate and return the right data efficiently, making their work faster, more accurate, and better organized. This chapter is ideal for anyone working in Office 2021 or Microsoft 365 who wants to unlock the full power of lookup functions in Excel.
target_audience: This course is for Excel users who want to retrieve data efficiently from tables and lists.
It’s ideal for professionals who need to automate pricing, tax rates, or discount lookups.
Anyone managing structured data and needing to search across rows or columns will benefit.
It’s great for learners who want to understand and apply VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, and XLOOKUP.
This course suits users who want to use drop-downs and list boxes for dynamic lookups.
It’s designed for those who need to build flexible formulas with INDEX and MATCH.
Students working with multi-column lookups or custom input tools like option buttons will benefit.
It’s for those transitioning from traditional lookup methods to modern dynamic functions.
Users aiming to create smarter worksheets that respond to user input will find it helpful.

courses.description:
Unlock the power of Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS) and learn how to apply this cutting-edge algorithm to real-world business challenges! In this hands-on course, we’ll take you from the foundational theory of Monte Carlo simulations to advanced MCTS implementations, all in Python.
What makes MCTS truly practical is its versatility. Whether you're optimizing supply chain logistics, scheduling complex tasks, enhancing game AI, or making strategic business decisions under uncertainty, MCTS shines where traditional algorithms struggle. Its ability to balance exploration and exploitation makes it perfect for solving problems with large, dynamic, and unpredictable environments—just like in real-world business scenarios.
You’ll start with the basics—understanding Monte Carlo simulations and Python coding strategies. Then, we’ll dive deep into tree search algorithms like BFS and DFS, setting the stage for mastering MCTS. Through step-by-step coding sessions, you'll implement key MCTS components: rollout, selection, expansion, and backpropagation.
But we don’t stop at theory. You’ll solve practical business problems, including job shop scheduling, using MCTS with real-world data. We’ll guide you through designing code structures, optimizing performance, and analyzing results effectively.
By the end of this course, you'll not only understand how MCTS works but also how to apply it confidently to complex decision-making problems.
target_audience: Applied Data scientists who are dealing with solving real-world problems.
Researchers who want to apply MCTS or combine their approach with MCTS.
Game developers who want to learn one of the most required algorithms for game development.
Operations research scientists who want to add new, yet powerful weapon to their optimization arsenal.
Planning and Scheduling Specialists who want to apply simple yet efficient algorithm to solve their daily complex planning tasks

courses.title: Questionnaire Design Boot Camp
courses.bio: An Introduction to Survey Writing
objectives: Articulate a research question
Create clear, standardized questions
Apply appropriate scales or create appropriate response lists
Select an appropriate mode for survey administration

requirements: Students should have an intended survey project or topic in mind.
courses.description:
This class is for anyone who wants to know what other people think, feel, or do! Maybe you want to understand what design features your customers want from your product, why people are buying from your competition, or what your employees are saying about you.
Basic survey research is a common tool, but most people never learn the key principles. Survey design is an art and a science-- better surveys get better data, which help you make smarter decisions. This class will prepare students to write effective questionnaires.
Students should be prepared with an idea for research they want to conduct using a survey. The class will begin with understanding your research aims and writing questions to meet these aims. Specific modules offered include: asking about sensitive topics (drinking! drugs! mean thoughts!); picking the right scale (numbers, letters, labels?); and avoiding pitfalls (more common than most people realize). Lectures will include basic theory but will focus primarily on "real world" examples.


Key Takeaways:


Upfront Work: Steps that need to be completed BEFORE collecting data.
Start With the End in Mind: Aday’s “who+what+where+when+why” formula for clear research questions.
How You'll Do It: Key considerations when choosing a survey mode.
Thinking Through Questions: The 5 stages of the Response Process Model.
Beyond Questions: Things to remember when selecting a scale
Putting it all together: Questionnaire layout
target_audience: This course is for anyone who wants to write a survey to understand what other people think, feel, or do.

courses.description:
Data has always been integral to improving health outcomes. In Big Data, Better Health, you will explore how cutting-edge analytics and machine learning methods reshape modern medicine. We’ll begin by unpacking essential metrics, then move on to the latest tools for disease surveillance, forecasting outbreaks, and accelerating drug development.
Along the way, you will discover how wearable tech, telehealth services, and AI-powered diagnostics empower healthcare providers and patients alike. We will also dive into key topics such as 3D printing, robotic-assisted surgery, and the ethical considerations of managing sensitive patient data. Whether you’re a healthcare professional looking to enhance clinical decisions, a data enthusiast eager to pivot into medicine, or a curious learner passionate about the future of healthcare, this course offers a clear roadmap for using data responsibly and effectively.
By the end, you will know how to leverage data science principles to anticipate disease patterns, personalize treatments, and navigate critical issues of data governance and privacy. Join us to learn how the power of data can revolutionize patient care, and shape a healthier world for everyone.
Throughout this course, you’ll gain not only theoretical insights but also practical examples that show how data science drives meaningful change in real-world clinical scenarios. We’ll discuss how advanced analytics can streamline administrative workflows, reduce costs, and improve patient satisfaction. From exploring the basics of epidemiology to delving into AI’s role in personalized medicine, you’ll see firsthand how a data-driven mindset can make healthcare more accessible and equitable. We will also touch on future-forward topics like blockchain, which can safeguard patient information while enabling more efficient sharing of medical records. Ultimately, our goal is to empower you with the tools and knowledge needed to thrive in this rapidly evolving field.
No matter your background, we welcome you to join us in exploring how the intersection of technology and healthcare can lead to groundbreaking solutions for people around the globe. Our lessons are beginner-friendly yet comprehensive, ensuring you walk away with actionable skills to harness big data effectively.

courses.description:
Unlock the power of data-driven investment strategies with the Stock Technicals App course, a complete hands-on guide to building a fully functional stock analytics platform using Python, Django, and MySQL. This course is perfect for developers, data analysts, and finance enthusiasts looking to merge software development with financial analysis.
Starting from the very basics, we walk you through setting up your Python virtual environment, configuring Django, and connecting to MySQL through tools like DataGrip. You’ll learn to fetch real-time stock data from Yahoo Finance APIs and structure that data into robust database tables representing income statements, balance sheets, holdings, and cash flows.
As the course progresses, you'll gain experience in financial data creation, inserting and querying stock data, and implementing calculations for returns, ratios, and fundamental summaries. We dive deep into technical analysis, including RSI, Bollinger Bands, and Fibonacci retracements, and demonstrate how to integrate these into an intuitive stock dashboard.
A major highlight of the course is building custom strategy views, identifying overvaluation/undervaluation, and designing a system to evaluate 5-year stock performance. Whether you're building a personal portfolio analysis tool or an MVP for a fintech startup, this course provides the structure, logic, and UI to get you there.
target_audience: Python and Django developers interested in applying their skills to stock market and financial analytics projects
Finance and data enthusiasts who want to learn how to build tools to analyze stock data

requirements: Download and install Minitab. Version 17.1 is used in the video lectures but earlier or later versions can also be used since little changes have been made in the way of manipulating data.
courses.description:
Get familiar with the tools, functioning and use of the Minitab statistical software package that you will need to analyze big data and make decisions about problems arising in business, production or engineering.
Get the skills of manipulating data in a worksheet when you are analyzing data.
Summarizing data in rows of a worksheet or data of variables in columns using numerical descriptive statistics.
Coding your data to different types.
Ranking and sorting your data.
Creating subsets of your data.
Combining or separating your data.
Animated video lessons about the process of manipulating data to prepare yourself to start learning the statistical methods of data analysis.
The video lessons give step-by step instructions you to select the appropriate menu commands or to write session window commands for specific problems. Screen animations highlight the important details of a session or draw your attention to the "tricks" applied. You can turn on subtitles to help follow the instrucions and explanations. Sample data of Minitab are used for demonstration so you do not need to download any additional dataset.
It is a short course including 10 lectures, a little more than half an hour, yet comprehensive and well enough to get the skill of using Minitab's capabilities for datasheet manipulation and to enable you to start real world data analysis in the next courses of "Foundation of Statistics with Minitab" or "Statistical Methods for Quality Improvement".
Watching a video, pausing it and doing the same steps simultaneously in your own Minitab is the best way of getting experience and practice in data manipulation. Repeating the sessions with different sample data develops your skill to easily handle big data files and helps you reach the stage when you feel that data analysis is a fun when you can have a look behind the scenes.
target_audience: It is great for students learning Statistics at their universities and for those who start using Statistics in their job. Especially for those dealing with quality matters in production or service sectors Minitab is the best choice. It is one of the most popular statistical computing packages in the world. The reason of its popularity is the easy to use menus and self-explanatory output windows and graphs.

courses.title: PMI Professional in Business Analysis - Exam Practice Tests
courses.bio: PMI-PBA Exam Success: Practice Tests for Business Analysis Excellence
courses.description:
The PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA) Exam Practice Tests package is designed to provide aspiring business analysis professionals with a rigorous preparation tool that closely mirrors the actual PMI-PBA® examination. This comprehensive resource includes 250 questions, complete with detailed explanations to help candidates thoroughly understand the rationale behind each answer. The questions are intentionally varied in difficulty levels to challenge and prepare candidates for the range of complexities they will encounter on the real exam.
Understanding that learners have different styles and preferences, the practice tests incorporate a diverse array of question types. Candidates will encounter:
Multiple-choice questions that test their ability to select the single best answer.
Questions with multiple correct answers, which require a deeper understanding of the content to identify all correct options.
True/false questions, offering a straightforward way to validate fundamental knowledge.
Fill-in-the-blank questions that assess a candidate's ability to recall and apply specific information.
The variety of question formats is designed to enhance learning retention and ensure that candidates are well-prepared for the actual exam experience.
Key topics covered in the practice tests include, but are not limited to:
Needs Assessment and Design Definition: Understanding how to assess business problems and opportunities, defining solution requirements, and driving stakeholder consensus.
Strategy Analysis: Identifying and evaluating business needs to support strategic decision-making.
Requirements Life Cycle Management: Managing and maintaining requirements from inception to retirement, ensuring they meet business objectives.
Solution Evaluation: Assessing the performance of and value delivered by implemented solutions against defined requirements.
This PMI-PBA® Exam Practice Tests package is an invaluable resource for anyone serious about achieving PMI-PBA® certification and advancing their career in business analysis.
target_audience: Aspiring Business Analysts: Individuals looking to enter the field of business analysis and seeking to solidify their understanding and skills through certification.
Experienced Business Analysts: Seasoned professionals aiming to formalize their expertise with a PMI-PBA® certification to enhance their career prospects and recognition in the field.
Project Managers: Project management professionals who want to deepen their knowledge of business analysis to improve project outcomes and stakeholder satisfaction.
Product Owners/Managers: Individuals responsible for guiding the success of a product and ensuring the project aligns with business needs, looking to enhance their analytical skills.
IT Professionals: Those in information technology roles seeking to bridge the gap between technical solutions and business objectives through effective analysis practices.
Change Management Professionals: Individuals involved in change management who wish to better understand how business analysis can facilitate effective change within an organization.

courses.description:
Blockchain technology and cryptography are two of the most transformative innovations of our time. Understanding them is crucial for anyone looking to stay ahead in the world of technology, finance, and security. This course, "Blockchain and Cryptography: 100 Questions to Understand and Apply," is designed to guide you through these concepts in a comprehensive, yet easy-to-understand format.
The course is structured around 100 key questions that cover the foundational principles, advanced concepts, and real-world applications of blockchain and cryptography. You’ll learn how blockchain works, the cryptographic techniques that secure it, and how these technologies are used in various industries like finance, healthcare, supply chain management, and more. Each question is followed by a detailed explanation, hands-on examples, and practical applications to ensure you not only understand the theory but also gain the skills to apply it.
By the end of the course, you’ll be equipped to confidently discuss blockchain and cryptography, implement smart contracts, and explore decentralized applications (dApps). Whether you’re a beginner with no prior knowledge or a professional looking to enhance your skills, this course will help you master the key concepts and tools needed to navigate the evolving world of blockchain and cryptography.
Join us today and start building the skills to shape the future of technology!

courses.title: 【ビジネスデータ集計を極める】エクセル関数マスターコース
courses.bio: 大量の Excel データを見ても困らない！手作業でムダな計算をしないで、関数でスピーディに計算できるビジネスパーソンを目指す講座です。完成版のエクセルファイルもダウンロードできるので、そのまま仕事にもつかえます！
objectives: ビジネスパーソンとして、ワンランク上のデータ集計、エクセル関数を理解できるようになります
SUM / IF関数といった基本から、INDEX / MATCH / INDIRECT関数といった応用レベルまでカバーします
文字列を抜き出す、日付や時間の計算といった複雑なデータ集計のコツも学べます
集計ミスが起きやすいポイントも解説します。さらにデータの入力規則など、集計ミスを防ぐテクニックも学べます

まずはここから～基本Excel関数～: SUMIFS （合計する（2つ以上の条件））
フィルター （絞り込む、並び替える）
ピボットテーブル （カンタンに集計）
複合参照 （行だけ、列だけ絶対参照）
「条件」Excel関数: AND / OR （条件を「両方」「いずれか」満たす）
「見つける」Excel関数: INDEX （タテに検索＆ヨコに検索）
MATCH （タテに何行目、ヨコに何行目）
「数える」Excel関数: " " （ダブルクオーテーション） 数式の中に文字列を入れる
* （アスタリスク）○○を含む文字を数える
「合計する」Excel関数: OFFSET （合計範囲を自由に指定）
「日付」関数: DATEDIF （開始日～終了日までの年月）
YEAR, MONTH, DAY （年・月・日だけ取り出す）
文字列: UPPER, LOWER, PROPER （大文字、小文字に変更）
MID, FIND, LEFT, LEN （必要な文字列を取り出す）
INDIRECT （参照するセル、範囲を指定）
【ダウンロード用】エクセルファイル: エクセルファイルのダウンロード

requirements: ありません
courses.description:
1日で Excel データ集計に強いビジネスパーソンを目指すコースです。


大量の販売データを見ても、困らない
いちいち手作業でムダな計算をしないで、関数でスピーディに計算
SUM関数、IF関数よりワンランク上の関数を知っておきたい
「こういうときって、どういう関数を使えばいいんだっけ？」と悩まない
それぞれの関数にありがちな「計算ミス」を知りたい
日付や時間といった計算しにくいデータも、すぐに集計できる


詳しい内容は以下のとおりです。


(1) まずはここから：基本関数
SUM  (合計を出す)
IF  (条件を分ける)
VLOOKUP  (データを見つける)
COUNTIF  (数える：1つの条件)
SUMIF  (合計する：1つの条件)
COUNTIFS (数える：2つ以上の条件)
SUMIFS (合計する：2つ以上の条件)
フィルター (絞り込む、並び替える)
ピボットテーブル (カンタンに集計)
複合参照  (行だけ、列だけ絶対参照)


(2) 「条件」関数を極める
IFS (複数条件)
AND (条件を「両方」満たす)
OR (条件を「どちらか」満たす)
IFERROR (エラーの場合)
CHOOSE (スイッチで切り替え)


(3) 「見つける」関数を極める
VLOOKUP (タテに検索)
MAX (最大値を探す)
MIN (最小値を探す)
RANK (順位)
HLOOKUP (ヨコに検索)
INDEX (タテに検索＆ヨコに検索)
MATCH (タテに何行目、ヨコに何行目)


(4) 「数える」関数を極める
COUNT (数字「だけ」数える)
COUNTA (数字「以外も」数える)
COUNTBLANK (空白セルを数える)
* (○○を含む文字を数える)
& (文字をつなげる)


(5) 「合計する」関数を極める
SUBTOTAL (重複を外して合計)
OFFSET (合計範囲を自由に指定)
PRODUCT (まとめて掛ける)
AVERAGE (平均値)
MEDIAN (中央値)
SUMPRODUCT (加重平均)
AVERAGEIF (条件つき平均値)


(6) 「日付、時間」関数を極める
TODAY (今日の日付)
EOMONTH (月末日)
ROUND (四捨五入)
EDATE (〇月後の日付)
DATEDIF (開始日～終了日までの年月)
YEAR, MONTH, DAY (年・月・日だけ取り出す)
TEXT (曜日の表示)
WORKDAY (〇日後の営業日)
NETWORKDAYS (営業日数の計算)


(7) 「文字列」関数を極める
UPPER, LOWER, PROPER (大文字、小文字に変更)
ASC, JIS (全角、半角に変更)
MID, FIND, LEFT, LEN (必要な文字列を取り出す)
DATE (日付データにする)
SUBSITUTE (置換)
INDIRECT (参照するセル、範囲を指定)
target_audience: 仕事でエクセルを使っているビジネスパーソン
大量のエクセルデータを使っている方
データ集計の計算ミスに困っている方
エクセル業務の生産性（スピード）を高めたい方

courses.description:
In recent years, analytics has become increasingly important in the world of business, particularly as organizations have access to more and more data. Managers today no longer make decisions based on pure judgment and experience; they rely on factual data and the ability to manipulate and analyze data to support their decisions. No matter what your academic business concentration is, you will most likely be a future user of analytics to some extent and work with analytics professionals.
Business analytics, or simply analytics, is the use of data, information technology, statistical analysis, quantitative methods, and mathematical or computer-based models to help managers gain improved insight into their business operations and make better, fact-based decisions. Business analytics is “a process of transforming data into actions through analysis and insights in the context of organizational decision-making and problem-solving.” Business analytics is supported by various tools, such as Microsoft Excel, commercial statistical software packages such as SAS or Minitab, and more complex business intelligence suites that integrate data with analytical software.
The purpose of this course is to provide you with a basic introduction to the concepts, methods, and models used in big data analytics for business intelligence so that you will develop not only an appreciation for its capabilities to support and enhance business decisions but also the ability to use business analytics at an elementary level in your work.
The course is spread over eight modules, and each module carries a quiz to reinforce the learning experience.
target_audience: Students of Management programs

courses.description:
Data exploration is the initial step in data analysis, where users explore a large data set in an unstructured way to uncover initial patterns, characteristics, and points of interest. This process isn’t meant to reveal every bit of information a dataset holds, but rather to help create a broad picture of important trends and major points to study in greater detail. Data exploration can use a combination of manual methods and automated tools such as data visualizations, charts, and initial reports.
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) is the first step in your data analysis process. Here, you make sense of the data you have and then figure out what questions you want to ask and how to frame them, as well as how best to manipulate your available data sources to get the answers you need.  You do this by taking a broad look at patterns, trends, outliers, unexpected results and so on in your existing data, using visual and quantitative methods to get a sense of the story this tells. You’re looking for clues that suggest your logical next steps, questions or areas of research.
Data analysis is a process of inspecting, cleansing, transforming, and modelling data with the goal of discovering useful information, informing conclusions, and supporting decision-making.
Data visualization is the presentation of data in a pictorial or graphical format. It enables decision makers to see analytics presented visually, so they can grasp difficult concepts or identify new patterns.
We will connect to Microsoft SQL Server and PostgreSQL as our data sources then explore the database data before creating visualizations.
target_audience: Beginner Data Analyst
Beginner Data Scientist

courses.description:
Working with Date and Time Functions, provides learners with a comprehensive understanding of how Excel handles dates and times and how to effectively use built-in functions to manipulate this data. The chapter starts by explaining Excel’s unique system for storing dates and times, laying a foundation for working confidently with these values.
Students will learn how to insert dynamic current dates and times using functions like TODAY() and NOW(). They will master extracting specific components from dates, such as year, month, day, and weekday, using functions like YEAR(), MONTH(), DAY(), and WEEKDAY(). The course covers calculating future or past dates with functions including DATE, EDATE, and WORKDAY, which help users plan timelines while excluding weekends and holidays.
Learners will also explore week-based functions such as WEEKNUM and calculate specific occurrences of weekdays within a month. Functions like NETWORKDAYS and DAYS360 enable users to calculate working days or durations based on financial standards. The chapter introduces YEARFRAC for calculating fractional years, useful in financial and project analysis.
In addition, students will convert text to date values with DATEVALUE and handle time data using the TIME function and related techniques. Practical examples such as employee timesheets demonstrate how to calculate working hours accurately.
By the end of this chapter, students will be equipped to manage and analyze date and time information efficiently, making it ideal for anyone working on scheduling, reporting, or time-sensitive data using Office 2021 or Microsoft 365.

courses.title: 1500 Big Data Engineer Interview Questions Practice Test
courses.bio: Big Data Engineer Interview Questions and Answers Practice Test | Freshers to Experienced | Detailed Explanations
courses.description:
1500 Big Data Engineer Interview Questions Practice Test
Big Data Engineer Interview Questions and Answers Practice Test | Freshers to Experienced | Detailed Explanations
Prepare rigorously for your next Big Data Engineer interview with the most comprehensive practice test available. This course delivers 1,500 meticulously crafted multiple-choice questions designed to simulate real-world technical interviews at top tech companies, FAANG, and Fortune 500 enterprises. Whether you’re a fresher building foundational knowledge or an experienced engineer brushing up on advanced concepts, this test bank covers every critical domain you’ll face—from Hadoop and Spark to real-time streaming, cloud pipelines, and system design.
Unlike generic question banks, every MCQ includes detailed explanations breaking down why the correct answer is right and why distractors are wrong. You’ll gain not just rote memorization but deep conceptual clarity to tackle even the most complex scenario-based questions.
Why This Course?
Industry-Aligned Structure: Questions are organized into 6 core sections mirroring actual Big Data Engineer job requirements.
Zero Fluff, 100% Practicality: Every question tests skills directly applicable to real engineering tasks (e.g., optimizing Spark jobs, designing fault-tolerant pipelines).
Build Confidence: Simulate timed interviews or learn at your own pace with instant feedback.
Covers All Experience Levels: Freshers get foundational clarity; seniors master advanced trade-offs (e.g., CAP theorem, JVM tuning).
Full Course Breakdown: 6 Expert-Validated Sections
(Each section contains exactly 250 questions for balanced depth)
Section 1: Core Concepts of Big Data
Master foundational principles including the 5 Vs of Big Data, data lifecycle stages, batch vs. real-time processing models, and industry-specific use cases (healthcare, finance, IoT). Understand how structured/unstructured data sources drive modern analytics.
Section 2: Big Data Tools and Frameworks
Dive deep into Hadoop (HDFS, YARN, MapReduce), Apache Spark (RDDs, DataFrames), Kafka, Flink, NoSQL databases (HBase, Cassandra), and ecosystem tools (Hive, Pig, Sqoop). Compare performance trade-offs and architectural roles.
Section 3: Data Pipeline Design and ETL Processes
Learn to design robust pipelines: ETL vs. ELT workflows, schema modeling, optimization techniques (partitioning, compression), error handling, and cloud integrations (AWS Glue, Azure HDInsight, Google Dataproc).
Section 4: Real-Time Data Processing and Streaming
Master streaming fundamentals: event-time processing, Kafka architecture (brokers, consumer groups), Flink/Spark Streaming windowing, and real-world use cases (fraud detection, IoT telemetry).
Section 5: Data Storage and Warehousing Solutions
Explore distributed storage (HDFS, S3), data lakes vs. warehouses, columnar formats (Parquet, ORC), query engines (Presto, Impala), and security compliance (GDPR, Kerberos).
Section 6: Advanced Topics and System Design
Tackle complex challenges: system design case studies (e-commerce, healthcare), CAP theorem trade-offs, performance tuning (shuffle optimization, JVM), ML integration (Spark MLlib), and emerging trends (serverless, edge computing).


Section 1: Core Concepts of Big Data
Sample Question:
Q: Which Big Data characteristic is primarily concerned with the consistency and reliability of data sources?
A) Volume
B) Velocity
C) Variety
D) Veracity
Correct Answer: D) Veracity
Explanation: Veracity addresses data accuracy, trustworthiness, and noise levels (e.g., inconsistent IoT sensor readings or social media misinformation). Volume (A) measures data size, Velocity (B) refers to data speed, and Variety (C) covers data format diversity. Misjudging veracity leads to flawed analytics—critical when building pipelines for healthcare or finance where data integrity is non-negotiable.

Section 2: Big Data Tools and Frameworks
Sample Question:
Q: In Apache Spark, what is the primary purpose of the repartition() transformation?
A) To reduce data shuffling during joins
B) To coalesce partitions without full shuffle
C) To evenly redistribute data across partitions
D) To cache intermediate data in memory
Correct Answer: C) To evenly redistribute data across partitions
Explanation: repartition() triggers a full shuffle to redistribute data uniformly across partitions, preventing skew. Option A describes broadcast joins; B refers to coalesce(); D relates to cache(). Uneven partitions cause resource wastage—this is essential for optimizing large-scale ETL jobs where skewed data can crash clusters.

Section 3: Data Pipeline Design and ETL Processes
Sample Question:
Q: When designing a cloud-based pipeline on AWS, which service is best suited for serverless orchestration of ETL workflows?
A) Amazon EMR
B) AWS Glue
C) Amazon Kinesis
D) Amazon Redshift
Correct Answer: B) AWS Glue
Explanation: AWS Glue provides fully managed, serverless ETL with automatic schema detection and job scheduling. EMR (A) requires cluster management; Kinesis (C) is for streaming; Redshift (D) is a warehouse. Serverless orchestration eliminates infrastructure overhead—critical for startups needing rapid pipeline deployment without DevOps overhead.

Section 4: Real-Time Data Processing and Streaming
Sample Question:
Q: In Apache Flink, how does event time processing handle out-of-order events?
A) By discarding late events
B) Using watermarks and allowed lateness
C) Through checkpointing mechanisms
D) Via keyed state backends
Correct Answer: B) Using watermarks and allowed lateness
Explanation: Watermarks define progress in event time, while allowedLateness specifies how long to wait for delayed events. Discarding late events (A) loses data; checkpointing (C) ensures fault tolerance but doesn’t reorder events; keyed state (D) manages per-key state. This is vital for financial systems where delayed transaction data must be processed accurately.

Section 5: Data Storage and Warehousing Solutions
Sample Question:
Q: Why is Parquet format preferred over CSV for analytical queries in data lakes?
A) It supports real-time streaming ingestion
B) Its columnar storage reduces I/O for selective queries
C) It natively encrypts data at rest
D) It integrates with NoSQL databases
Correct Answer: B) Its columnar storage reduces I/O for selective queries
Explanation: Parquet stores data by column (not row), so queries scanning specific columns (e.g., SELECT sales FROM table) read only relevant data—slashing I/O and costs. CSV (row-based) reads entire rows. Parquet lacks native streaming (A) or encryption (C); it’s for structured analytics, not NoSQL (D). This optimization is non-negotiable for cost-efficient petabyte-scale analytics.

Section 6: Advanced Topics and System Design
Sample Question:
Q: In a distributed system, if a database prioritizes consistency and partition tolerance (CP), what must it sacrifice according to the CAP theorem?
A) Low latency
B) Availability during network partitions
C) Data durability
D) Horizontal scalability
Correct Answer: B) Availability during network partitions
Explanation: CAP theorem states you can only guarantee two of: Consistency (C), Availability (A), Partition Tolerance (P). A CP system (e.g., HBase) rejects writes during partitions to maintain consistency—sacrificing availability. Low latency (A) isn’t a CAP pillar; durability (C) and scalability (D) are orthogonal. Misapplying CAP leads to catastrophic outages in e-commerce during network failures.


Key Outcomes
By completing this course, you will:
Confidently answer 95%+ of Big Data Engineer interview questions.
Understand how tools work under the hood—not just memorize features.
Recognize subtle distinctions between similar technologies (e.g., Spark Streaming vs. Flink).
Apply best practices for optimizing pipelines, storage, and security.
Solve system design problems with scalable, fault-tolerant architectures.
Why Trust This Course?
100% Interview-Focused: Questions sourced from actual FAANG, Netflix, and Fortune 500 interviews.
No Outdated Content: Covers modern tools (Spark 3.x, Kafka 3.0+) and cloud-native patterns.
Learning Over Memorization: Explanations teach why—preparing you for follow-up questions.
Structured for Efficiency: 250 questions per section lets you target weak areas fast.
Enroll today to transform uncertainty into expertise. This isn’t just a practice test—it’s your blueprint to acing the Big Data Engineer interview and landing your dream role.
target_audience: Aspiring Big Data Engineers seeking structured interview preparation with foundational-to-advanced concepts for entry-level roles.
Mid-career Data Professionals (Scientists, Analysts, Developers) transitioning into engineering roles requiring pipeline design expertise.
Cloud Platform Users (AWS/Azure/GCP) needing hands-on practice with cloud-native data tools like Glue, Dataproc, and HDInsight.

requirements: A basic understanding of programming concepts will be helpful but is not required.

courses.description:
Optimization is at the core of decision-making in engineering, business, finance, artificial intelligence, and operations research. If you want to solve complex problems efficiently, understanding optimization algorithms is essential.
This course provides a thorough understanding of optimization techniques, from fundamental methods like Linear Programming (LP) and Integer Programming (IP) to advanced metaheuristic algorithms such as Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO), Simulated Annealing, and Ant Colony Optimization. We will implement these techniques using Python, Julia, MATLAB, and R, ensuring you can apply them across different platforms.
Throughout the course, we will work with real-world optimization problems, covering essential topics like the Traveling Salesman Problem, Portfolio Optimization, Job Shop Scheduling, and more. You will gain hands-on experience with numerical optimization, stochastic optimization, and machine learning-based approaches.
We will also explore key mathematical concepts behind optimization and discuss how these methods are applied across different industries. Whether you are an engineer, data scientist, researcher, or analyst, this course will provide the practical skills needed to optimize solutions effectively.
No prior experience with optimization is required; we’ll start from the basics and gradually move into advanced topics. By the end of this course, you’ll be able to confidently apply optimization techniques in real-world applications.
Join now and start learning!
target_audience: This course is designed for engineers, data scientists, researchers, and business analysts who want to apply optimization techniques to real-world problems.

courses.description:
The quantification and qualification of data play pivotal roles in comprehending and navigating the intricacies of the world.


How can we make this simple to understand, share, and engage in conversations?


Whether expressed through numerical precision or qualitative descriptions, data forms a vital link connecting us to the multifaceted aspects of our reality. Designed primarily for human analysis, data serves as the bedrock for informed decision-making and effective problem-solving across diverse fields. Its significance lies in its capacity to yield insights, empowering individuals to make informed choices in scientific, economic, and social contexts. In the sphere of communication, the transformation of raw data into coherent narratives assumes paramount importance. This not only enhances accessibility but also cultivates a deeper understanding among diverse audiences, bridging the gap between complex information and meaningful insights. The art of storytelling with data extends beyond academia; it emerges as a valuable skill contributing to the cultivation of relationships, both personal and professional.


Recognizing the perpetual evolution of information and communication, continuous learning becomes essential. The mention of a course in this context underscores the ongoing relevance of developing skills in data-driven storytelling. Such skills not only empower individuals to navigate the dynamic landscape of data but also facilitate effective communication and decision-making, fostering success in an ever-changing world. In essence, the synergy between data, storytelling, and human connections forms a tapestry that weaves together understanding, communication, and the pursuit of knowledge, reflecting the interconnected nature of our experiences.
target_audience: MBAs, Managers and Senior Leaders

objectives: Learn how to create pricing formulas to calculate costs, markups, and discounts automatically.
Understand how to apply break-even analysis to assess product profitability.
Use Excel to calculate cost of goods sold for accurate business reporting.
Build formulas for gross and net margin to track business performance.
Analyze sales using financial ratios and formula-driven insights.
Calculate fixed-asset ratios to understand asset efficiency and turnover.
Manage inventory using formulas that track levels, usage, and restocking.
Measure accounts receivable and payable using liquidity-focused ratios.
Create working capital formulas to monitor cash flow and financial health.
Apply liquidity index formulas to assess short-term financial stability.

requirements: Microsoft Excel (Office 2021 or Microsoft 365) installed.
Basic knowledge of Excel (e.g., entering data, simple calculations).
Access to a computer with a stable internet connection.
No prior advanced Excel skills required; suitable for beginners.
courses.description:
Implementing Basic Business Formulas, offers a comprehensive exploration of key Excel formulas designed specifically for practical business applications. This chapter equips learners with the skills to create dynamic and customizable models that streamline financial analysis and business decision-making.
The course begins by introducing essential pricing formulas, including methods to calculate price discounts and understand markups, allowing students to develop flexible pricing strategies. Learners will then delve into break-even point analysis, gaining the ability to evaluate product profitability and business sustainability accurately.
A significant portion of the chapter focuses on financial formulas such as sales ratios, cost of goods sold (COGS), and calculations of gross and net margins. These concepts help learners assess profitability and operational efficiency. Inventory management is thoroughly covered, with formulas for tracking stock levels, calculating inventory ratios, and managing reorder points to maintain optimal stock control.
Students will also learn liquidity-related calculations, including accounts receivable and payable ratios, working capital assessment, and liquidity indexes, which are critical for monitoring cash flow and short-term financial health.
Throughout the chapter, learners engage with real-world examples and case studies, applying formulas to scenarios such as pricing models, inventory management, and financial reporting. By the end, students will be proficient in implementing basic business formulas to automate calculations, improve accuracy, and support data-driven decisions within Excel, using Office 2021 and Microsoft 365.
target_audience: Business students looking to improve their Excel skills for financial analysis.
Entry-level analysts who want to master core business formulas in Excel.
Entrepreneurs managing their own pricing, cost, and margin calculations.
Finance interns who need practical Excel experience for daily tasks.
Office professionals aiming to build smarter spreadsheets for business metrics.
Accountants who want to enhance efficiency using Excel’s built-in functions.
Small business owners who want better insight into cash flow and working capital.
Inventory managers needing simple Excel tools to track stock and turnover.
Administrative staff who support finance teams and need formula knowledge.
Anyone who wants to use Excel for real-world financial problem-solving.

courses.description:
Welcome to "Power BI for Kids," a course designed to introduce young learners to the world of business intelligence. In this course, kids will learn the fundamentals of business intelligence and gain valuable skills using a powerful data visualisation tool, Power BI.
Throughout the course, kids will be guided through the process of building their own dashboard, starting with an overview of Power BI's user interface and working their way up to creating charts and graphs to represent data. Along the way, kids will learn how to import and manipulate data and use layout and formatting options to create a professional-looking final product.
Whether your child is interested in pursuing a career in business intelligence or simply wants to gain valuable skills for their future, this course is the perfect starting point. By the end of the course, kids will have a solid foundation in business intelligence and the skills they need to continue exploring the exciting world of data visualization.


Learning Outcomes


1. Understand the basics of business intelligence and how it is used to make data-driven decisions.
2. Gain hands-on experience using Power BI to import, manipulate, and visualize data.
3. Learn how to create professional-looking dashboards and reports using Power BI's layout and formatting options.
4. Understand how to connect Power BI to different data sources and extract relevant data for analysis.
5. Develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills by working through real-world data scenarios.
6. Build confidence in working with data and visualizing insights.
7. Understand how to apply their knowledge of business intelligence in their personal and professional lives.




This is the first edition of the course, and we plan to release more levels in the future to explore the complex functionalities of Power BI
target_audience: This course is designed for students aged 8 to 18 who are interested in learning business intelligence skills using real-life BI tools, such as Power BI.
Absolute beginners to Power BI are welcome to enroll in the course.

courses.description:
The IT industry is changing fast — and companies are desperate for skilled Business Analysts who can bridge the gap between technology and real business needs. Are you ready to become one of them?
Imagine being the reason an IT project succeeds when so many fail.
Imagine becoming the trusted bridge that helps businesses deliver true value — not just software.
In "IT Business Analysis: From Fundamentals to Career Growth", you won’t just learn the basics.
Through a rich combination of engaging video lectures, real-world examples, step-by-step guidance and hands-on exercises, you’ll develop the skills, mindset and confidence to step into the BA role with authority.
This course is built to transform you:
From task-taker to strategic partner.
From order-filler to problem-solver.
From someone who "gathers requirements" to someone who drives real business value.


Inside this course, you’ll learn how to:
Understand why IT projects fail — and how Business Analysts prevent disaster.
Deeply uncover and define client needs, even when clients themselves aren't sure what they need.
Elicit, document, validate, and manage requirements with clarity and strategic insight.
Apply powerful techniques like SWOT Analysis, Gap Analysis, Root Cause Analysis, Use Case Modeling, BPMN, and User Stories.
Communicate, negotiate, and resolve conflicts with stakeholders at every level of a project.
Drive projects toward outcomes that actually solve business problems — not just complete tasks.
But this course isn’t just about skills — it’s about your career. You’ll discover exactly how to:
Break into the BA role (even without prior IT experience).
Build your portfolio and real-world credibility.
Navigate your career path with certifications and growth strategies.
Position yourself not just as a BA, but as a future leader in the field.


What’s Included in the Course:
High-quality video lectures that simplify complex ideas and connect theory to real IT project realities.
An Interactive Companion Workbook with exercises, templates and real-world scenarios to deepen your learning and help you apply concepts immediately.
Quizzes and checkpoints to validate your understanding and reinforce key concepts.
Practical activities that help you apply new skills immediately to realistic scenarios.
Downloadable templates and resources to use in your projects and interviews.
1-on-1 instructor support to answer your questions and clear up any confusion as you move forward.
Lifetime access to all materials, so you can revisit lessons whenever you need a refresher or face new challenges.
This course is designed not just to teach you what Business Analysis is, but to help you become the Business Analyst companies dream of hiring.
By the end of this course, you'll be equipped to walk into an IT environment with the skills, tools and mindset needed to make a real difference to projects, to businesses and to your own professional growth.


Your Future Starts Here.
There’s a shortage of Business Analysts who can think critically, communicate clearly and deliver solutions that actually matter. If you’re ready to build real skills, real confidence and a real future — this course was made for you.
Enrol now and start building the career that companies are desperately searching for.
